de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.algo.lca
Class CycleDetector

java.lang.Object
  de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.algo.lca.CycleDetector

public class CycleDetector
extends java.lang.Object

This is a cycle detector based on Exercise 7 of section 3.1 of Volume 2 of Knuth's "The Art of Computer Programming". This is guaranteed to detect an infinite cycle, and may or may not spot a transient repeat.

Author:
A. G. McDowell (original version)

          Standard constructor

Method Detail

check

public void check(java.lang.Object o)
           throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                  java.lang.IllegalStateException
Check a new pointer, which must not be null

Parameters:
o - and object to check against a previous object
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if o is null
java.lang.IllegalStateException - guaranteed eventually if the stream of objects gets stuck in an infinite loop: perhaps also thrown for shorter repeats
